meanings.definition: Filled with an excessive amount of energy or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The kids were hypercharged after eating too much candy at the party.
meanings.sent2: The concert was hypercharged with the crowd's enthusiastic cheers.
meanings.sent3: The hypercharged puppy ran around the yard, chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her hypercharged enthusiasm for the project was contagious to the whole team.
meanings.sent5: The hypercharged atmosphere at the stadium made the game even more thrilling.

meanings.definition: To increase the energy or excitement of something to an excessive level.
meanings.sent1: The coach hypercharged the team with a motivational speech before the game.
meanings.sent2: The DJ hypercharged the party by playing upbeat music all night.
meanings.sent3: She hypercharged her morning coffee with an extra shot of espresso.
meanings.sent4: The storm hypercharged the waves, creating a spectacular sight at the beach.
meanings.sent5: The magician hypercharged the audience's anticipation with his mysterious smile.
